intro: Casparia subrotundifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf casparia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-yellow, and it produces small, spherical fruits that contain one or two seeds. Casparia subrotundifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
